description: From Middle English salten, from Old English sealten, from Proto-West Germanic *saltan, from Proto-Germanic *saltanaz (“salted”), past participle of *saltaną (“to salt”), equivalent to salt +‎ -en. Cognate with Saterland Frisian soalten (“salted; salty”), Dutch gezouten (“salted”), German Low German solten (“salted”), German gesalzen (“salted”).

adjectives.description: salten (comparative more salten, superlative most salten)

verbs.description: salten (third-person singular simple present saltens, present participle saltening, simple past and past participle saltened)

entries.meaning: (transitive, intransitive) To make or become salty or salted
